sentence.text: It has been conjectured that the archers and many of the foot-soldiers who fought at Hastings and feature in the Bayeux Tapestry were fighting in return for pay .
How many more died before ever reaching hospital can only be conjectured .
Indeed it might almost be conjectured that those families in which political nous was widely distributed were just those that found the principle of primogeniture unpalatable .
` We conjecture that she was brought to Bartholomew Close on a market-porter 's barrow , and we feel that the journey started not too far away .
I conjecture that co-adapted meme-complexes evolve in the same kind of way as co-adapted gene-complexes .
If I notice the banker fidget and look at his watch , I may well conjecture that the game is about to be brought to an end , and I may therefore feel tempted to defect .
I do not know of any direct evidence that sexually transmitted diseases increase the libido of sufferers , but I conjecture that it would be worth looking into .
We can conjecture that some of the slaves had bought themselves to serfdom ; that penury had compelled the free to sell their freedom for bread .
So in the early 1920s some people conjectured that it may be possible that helium -- element number two in the periodic table of the elements -- could be built from two hydrogen atoms .
Though statistics are lacking , it seems reasonable to conjecture that these conditions foster child abuse and neglect , even infanticide .
The London embassy conjectured that Anglo-American relations might suffer if Labour returned to office .

Modern archaeologists have at least been able to conjecture possible rational motives for the primitive societies to have devoted enormous efforts to building pyramids or stonehenges , such as their use as astronomical or more likely astrological observatories .
Given his statistical results , he conjectured the existence of some otherwise completely unknown feature -- the genetic code .
The majority -- I would conjecture the vast majority -- of teachers , particularly in secondary schools , are feeling overloaded , pushed around , confused , fed up and unappreciated .
We can conjecture immense social strife , as the ` haves " battle with the ` have-nots " .
